newsitem.title: ESTONIA: STANDARD SHARE CAPITAL UP TO 33.2 MLN KROONS.
newsitem.headline: STANDARD SHARE CAPITAL UP TO 33.2 MLN KROONS.

text.p: Estonian furniture producer Standard said on Friday that its shareholders had decided to raise the company's share capital to 33.2 million kroons from 920,000 kroons.
"The company will raise the capital from its equity," Standard chairman Enn Veskimagi told Reuters.
The shareholders also decided on the 1996 profit distribution. Some 3.6 million kroons will be assigned to the reserves and 1.3 million kroons to the share capital, Veskimagi said.
Veskimagi said the company, one of the largest furniture makers in Estonia, is preparing to list its shares on the bourse in autumn.
Standard had a turnover of 47 million kroons and profit 7.4 million kroons during the four months of this year.
Standard's largest shareholders are Forekspank, Baltic Investment Fund and some individuals.
